intro: Ouratea welwitschii, commonly known as the African holly, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
